posts.post_content:
Sarkhan is seriously misrated. I play three in a discard (wierd, I know) but he fixes one of the main problems, my ability to attack, say with a [Hypnotic Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Specter) which happens to be my only creature. Now, I need only to attack, blow up my specter, and replace him with an untapped, relatively large creature.
  
   
Also, he works wonders with [Demigod of Revenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demigod of Revenge), a$$uming you have two. Play one, smack for 5, destroy for a dragon. Next turn, play the second Demigod, swing with both Demigods and dragon for 15, then use Sarkhans' final to smack for 5 more.
posts.html:
Sarkhan is seriously misrated. I play three in a discard (wierd, I know) but he fixes one of the main problems, my ability to attack, say with a Hypnotic Specter which happens to be my only creature. Now, I need only to attack, blow up my specter, and replace him with an untapped, relatively large creature.

Also, he works wonders with Demigod of Revenge, a$$uming you have two. Play one, smack for 5, destroy for a dragon. Next turn, play the second Demigod, swing with both Demigods and dragon for 15, then use Sarkhans' final to smack for 5 more.

posts.post_content:
I think RDW is slowly including black I heard they're including cards like blightning. If that's true, this is gonna be pretty good with cards like ball lightning and hellspark elemental, since those guys die anyway. It can also act as removal if you're really desperate (say a baneslayer is kicking your ass). And of course if you have enough dragons, the ultimate (which can be used once it hits the field) ends the game.  
  
I think it's better than its current 2.5 rating.

posts.post_content:
This card has been underestimated. They actually emphasized him well with his current identity. His first ability really defines how far he's willing to go into madness in search of power and knowledge, despite the harm it will do to him. His second ability, if most of you think about it, not just it can change a few weaklings into 5/5 dragons (not to mention they can FLY), Sarkhan can make the 'mighty' Eldrazi (NOT yours, obviously) downsized, the real objective is to kill off their annihilating instincts been used against you. His ultimatum can be quite devasting if the plan is tactifully executed.
  
   
With 7 counters, you may use the 'Dragon-morphic' ability three times, and then use go for the 'MAD for knowledge' for a card since it it does not have a cost for loyalty, since it only state how much damage Sarkhan will be dealt.
  
   
Let's face it. The Eldrazi do seem great and powerful, but even they are useless if they can't be put into effect/play, or protect their owners from the l... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: AngelxLegna clearly has no mind of his own, at pre-release decks with Sarkhan were winning more than decks with Gideon : ) Oh, and for others who are still thinking about hating on this card, think of the card advantage this gives to the already card advantage heavy Jund. Turn 5, I drop Sarkhan the Mad. I have a Thrinax on the field, I use his -2. Thrinax hits the graveyard, I got 3 1/1 Saporlings AND a 5/5 flyer out of the deal. Sarkhan the Mad is amazing, pure and simple.

posts.post_content:
Give [Bloodthorn Taunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthorn Taunter) to your dragon babies and they'll run as fast as Kenyans! People will see them running and think they're Kenyans! Then there will be a tie and they'll be [Journey to Nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Journey to Nowhere)'d back to Kenyaaaa!  
  
I love this planeswalker. He's affordable (both cash and mana-wise) and he plays well in Jund and [Demigod of Revenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demigod of Revenge) decks. If you're a Johnny like I usually am, he works great with some cards from the Alara block, especially [Where Ancients Tread](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Where Ancients Tread), because he cranks out dragons (basically [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) or [Lightning Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Axe) stapled to [Dragon Roost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Roost)), he makes [Dragon Appeasement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Appeasement) pretty playable (it's incredibly powerful with Eldrazi Spawn tokens, don't laugh) and above all, he can fire his cannon and win the game for you if you have enough dragons in play. Just play with Doubloon Season/a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
